meanings.sent1: She felt very lucking when she found money in her old jacket.
meanings.sent2: The lucking cat always seemed to find a sunny spot for a nap.
meanings.sent3: The lucking squirrel found all the nuts hidden in the garden.
meanings.sent4: The lucking flower bloomed beautifully despite the dry weather.
meanings.sent5: The lucking student aced the test without studying much.

meanings.definition: To be fortunate or successful by chance.
meanings.sent1: He was lucking into a great job opportunity.
meanings.sent2: She lucking out when she won the raffle without even buying a ticket.
meanings.sent3: The team lucking their way to victory with a last-minute goal.
meanings.sent4: The detective lucking upon a crucial piece of evidence in an old file.
meanings.sent5: The artist lucking upon inspiration in the most unexpected places.

meanings.definition: To rely on luck or chance.
meanings.sent1: They were lucking on the weather to have a successful outdoor event.
meanings.sent2: She was lucking that her train was delayed, allowing her to catch it.
meanings.sent3: The gambler lucking on a winning streak at the casino.
meanings.sent4: The explorer lucking on a hidden cave while wandering through the forest.
meanings.sent5: The chef lucking on a rare ingredient that made the dish extraordinary.
